      • decidePlayersOrder

        public String[] decidePlayersOrder(String[] playerNames)
        Description copied from interface: SetupService
        Randomically assign one position for each player.
        Specified by:
        decidePlayersOrder in interface SetupService
        Parameters:
        playerNames - The name of the players that will participate on the game. Should be between 2-4.
        Returns:
        reordered array, where 1st player will be on index 0, 2nd on 1, 3rd on 2 (if existent) and 4th on 3 (if existent).

        Parameters:
        playerCount - number of players in the game.
        Returns:

      • startLake

        public void startLake(List<ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LakeTile> lake,
                      ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LakeTile initialTile)
        Description copied from interface: SetupService
        Setup step #1:

        Place the starting Lake Tile in the center of the play area face down. Flip the tile face up and orient it so that one player is facing the red side and each other player is facing a different side.

        Specified by:
        startLake in interface SetupService

      • dealPlayerTiles

        public void dealPlayerTiles(ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LakeTile[] totalTiles,
                            ca.concordia.lanternsentities.Player[] players)
        Description copied from interface: SetupService
        Setup step #2:

        Deal 3 Lake Tiles to each player face down. Lake Tiles are held in hand and kept secret from other players.

        Specified by:
        dealPlayerTiles in interface SetupService

      • drawTileStack

        public void drawTileStack(Stack<ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LakeTile> tiles,
                          ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LakeTile[] totalTiles,
                          int playerCount)
        Description copied from interface: SetupService
        Setup step #3:

        Create a draw stack of Lake Tiles. The number of tiles in the stack depends on player count:

        • 4 Players: 20 tiles
        • 3 Players: 18 tiles
        • 2 Players: 16 tiles

        By the end of this method, the tiles collection will be populated.

        Specified by:
        drawTileStack in interface SetupService
        Parameters:
        tiles - stack to be populated.
        totalTiles - total stack of tiles in the game.
        playerCount - number of players in the game.

      • separateLanternCards

        public void separateLanternCards(ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LanternCardWrapper[] cards,
                                 int playerCount)
        Description copied from interface: SetupService
        Setup step #4:

        Separate the Lantern Cards by color into 7 stacks. These stacks are collectively called the supply The number of cards

        in each stack depends on player count:

        • 4 Players: 8 cards
        • 3 Players: 7 cards
        • 2 Players: 5 cards

        By the end of this method, the cards stacks will be populated.

        Specified by:
        separateLanternCards in interface SetupService
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards stacks to populate.
        playerCount - number of players in the game.

      • setDedicationTokens

        public void setDedicationTokens(ca.concordia.lanternsentities.DedicationTokenWrapper[] dedications,
                                int playerCount)
        Description copied from interface: SetupService
        Setup step #5: Set aside the 3 generic Dedication Tokens.

        Setup step #6: Separate Dedication Tokens by type into 3 stacks. Arrange each stack in descending order of value.

        • 4 Players: use all tokens
        • 3 Players: remove tokens with 4 dots
        • 2 Players: remove tokens with 3 or 4 dots

        By the end of this method the dedication stacks will be populated.

        Specified by:
        setDedicationTokens in interface SetupService
        Parameters:
        dedications - the dedication token stacks to be set
        playerCount - number of players in the game.

      • distributeInitialLanterns

        public void distributeInitialLanterns(List<ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LakeTile> lake,
                                      ca.concordia.lanternsentities.LanternCardWrapper[] cards,
                                      ca.concordia.lanternsentities.Player[] players)
        Description copied from interface: SetupService
        Setup step #7: Give each player one Lantern Card corresponding to the color on the side of the starting Lake Tile he is facing. Each players Lantern Cards are always kept in front of them, visible for everyone to see.

        fyi, setup step #8 (Give the player with the red Lantern Card, the color of good fortune, the start player marker) is unnecessary, as start player can be inferred by first tile in Game.getLake() plus first player in the Game.getPlayers().

        Specified by:
        distributeInitialLanterns in interface SetupService
        Parameters:
        lake - game lake
        cards - lantern cards available to be distributed
        players - the players in the game.
